body.name: MageGee Mechanical Gaming Keyboard, Wired USB Adjustable Backlight Keyboard, New Mechanical Storm 100% Anti-ghosting Keyboard with Blue Switches for Windows PC/MAC Games (White)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 14 hrs 44 mins
features: Professional Blue Switches: gaming keyboard is equipped with Blue switches, which are linear, top-to-bottom switches. These switches require less force to press down and the keys feel smoother and easier to use. No tactile "bump" but responsive. A great choice for work and play!
N-key Rollover: 100% anti-ghosting 104 keys ensure the most accurate simultaneous key presses. Reassign any key or set up the most extreme macros for effortless gaming.
Dynamic Backlight: 18 backlight models allow you to type in the dark. You can adjust its brightness with FN + Up/Down. Arrow Key in any non-breathing mode.
Extreme Durability: USB plug&play.no driver needed.thus you can play with it without fatigue .Solid base with double injection ABS keycaps design, it is built to withstand a lifetime of gaming.

Wide Compatibility: Supports computer system including Windows10, Windows 8, Windows 7, Mac OS X, Windows XP, Windows VISTA, etc. With USB golden plated port to ensure the stability of data transmission. No delay, no error.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Work and Play Bliss - MageGee Mechanical Gaming Keyboard!
reviews.reviewText: The MageGee Mechanical Gaming Keyboard has seamlessly integrated itself into my daily work routine, becoming an absolute favorite.What sets this keyboard apart is its satisfying click clack sound with each keystroke, creating a delightful typing experience. Beyond the auditory pleasure, its tactile feedback and responsive keys significantly enhance productivity.The durability and build quality are impressive, ensuring longevity despite heavy everyday use. Its gaming roots shine through in its reliability, making it perfect not just for gaming but also for professional tasks.I appreciate how this keyboard effortlessly balances work functionality with a touch of gaming aesthetics. The backlit keys add a stylish flair, making it suitable for both work and leisure.If you're like me, enjoying the rhythm of clicky keys while getting work done, the MageGee Mechanical Gaming Keyboard is an excellent choice. It's transformed my work experience into something I genuinely look forward to each day.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I LOVE it!
reviews.reviewText: It is NOT an RGB keyboard. It is white backlit. As long as you know that, you should love this keyboard. I did not have the problem with the faceplate being lose like some of the other reviewers did. Not sure if this is a hit or miss issue or something the manufacturer solved but my faceplate is extremely sturdy.Very clicky and light sound to the keys (blue switches, clicky-er than red). If you're not wanting a super clicky keyboard, this one probably isn't for you. I would go for red switches for that normal keyboard sound or brown for a super soft sound.Very easy to pick the lighting set up you want. 6 brightness settings, a ton of different options for customizing how your keyboard lights up, and very responsive lighting when you select an option that breathes when you click certain keys. Responsiveness works to a certain point (it only allows for three animations running at one point) but it still looks gorgeous no matter what.Every key works, none of the keys are loose. I switched the stock keys out for some pudding keycaps and they are GORGEOUS on this keyboard. The entire thing is pink, including the cord, which fits with my desk setup very nicely. I added some teal and lilac pudding keycaps and switched the stock keycaps over to another keyboard (that had cherry switches) and everything works perfectly.The only issue I'm running into (and only on certain apps, so it may be more of an application issue than an issue with my keyboard), is that sometimes the 'e' key duplicates or doesn't want to type out the letter. So far as I'm writing this, I haven't had that issue so it may just be with a certain application on my computer causing that.Sidenote, I love that there's two kickstand heights on the back of the keyboard. I don't elevate my keyboard usually but I like the comfort of having it elevated on the smallest kickstand.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars I love this keyboard, but....
reviews.reviewText: I have had it for just over a year. Some of they keys are beginning to double-tap, which is beginning to drive me nuts. Not sure how to fix it at the moment, and it's getting annoying. Also, the light settings seem a bit wonky running under Linux. (I use Mint). I'm sure I turn off the lights then suddenly they're on again. Might be a Linux thing, might be the keyboard.I love the feel of the red switches though. Not loud like blue, yet still have a nice click, in my opinion.Overall, I think it is a good keyboard. I do not know if the switches are swappable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent for the price
reviews.reviewText: It's hard to beat this keyboard for the price -- a lot of basic, membrane-type keyboards cost more than this mechanical keyboard does. I purchased this keyboard for work, as the blue-switch keyboard I was using previously was driving my coworkers crazy.The red switches feel good overall and are a lot quieter than those blues, while still having a bit of sound (which I wanted). The spacebar does have a bit of a rattle / squeak, which would probably bother me if I was using this as my primary gaming keyboard; for basic work-oriented typing, though, it's fine for me. One of my coworkers liked the keyboard so much, he went out and purchased the same one for himself.I like that the keyboard is full-sized, as I need the numpad to do my job. I also like that it has a smaller ANSI-style Enter key; a lot of the cheaper mechanical keyboards available have the larger L shaped Enter key, which drives me bonkers.While I don't typically care about keyboard lighting schemes, I do actually enjoy the way this keyboard lights up by default -- pressing a key releases a "wave" of blue lights that spreads out from the key pressed throughout the rest of the keyboard. It makes for a neat appearance.I've been using the keyboard for about a month now and it's still functioning as expected. I don't imagine it will last all that long, but for the price it's well worth the cost.

Los materiales se sienten de muy buena calidad, los switches tienen la sensación al tacto esperada, muy buenos. Llego un día antes de lo esperado, venía bien protegido y llego en buenas condiciones, lo recomiendo si se busca un teclado con switch rojo, con buena calidad de materiales, y a un precio accesible.

I recently purchased this mechanical keyboard, and I've been really happy with my purchase. Here's a quick rundown of what I like about it:Affordable Price: This keyboard is a great budget-friendly option for anyone looking to upgrade from a regular membrane keyboard to a mechanical one without breaking the bank.Tactile and Clicky Switches: The mechanical switches on this keyboard have a nice tactile feel and a satisfying click. Typing on it is a pleasure, and the audible feedback is a bonus for those who love the clicky sound.Solid Build Quality: Despite its budget-friendly price, the keyboard feels sturdy and well-built. The keys have a good amount of resistance, and it doesn't flex or creak under pressure.LED Backlighting: The RGB LED backlighting is a nice touch, allowing you to customize the keyboard's appearance. The lighting effects are quite impressive, and it adds a bit of flair to your setup.Plug and Play: Setting up the keyboard was a breeze. It's plug-and-play, so you can start using it immediately without any complicated software installations.Compact Design: I appreciate the compact design of this keyboard, which saves space on my desk while still offering a full set of keys. It's great for small workspaces.Function Key Shortcuts: The keyboard has handy function key shortcuts for media control and other functions, which is a nice convenience.In summary, this mechanical keyboard is a great value for the price. It offers a satisfying typing experience, has a durable build, and the customizable LED lighting is a fun extra. If you're looking for an affordable mechanical keyboard, I highly recommend giving this one a try!
Keyboard came earlier than expected. Was put in a larger box for extra protection!Colour is as exact as the photos and works nicely :)

reviews.reviewTitle: Teclado mecanico a buen precio con algunos inconvenientes.
reviews.reviewText: En general me gustó el teclado, sin embargo la descripción dice que es "hot swappable" y no es así, todos los switches están soldados a la placa madre. Además los estabilizadores tienen mucho juego y son muy ruidosos, tuve que modificarlos para quitarles completamente el ruido y eso significa tener que desoldar algunos de los switches.

reviews.reviewTitle: It feels very durable and it is heavy more than 600gms
reviews.reviewText: It's a huge and heavy keyboard so it not portable at all. The best thing of the keyboard is it sound it has a tactile sound which feels good while typing. And it is very good quality and lastly I'm not impressed with the lighting it has only one colour but the logo looks so good when it's glowing
